name: Roo.UpdateManager

config.name: listeners

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Performs an async request, updating this element with the response. If params are specified it uses POST, otherwise it uses GET.

params.name: url
params.desc:
The url for this request or a function to call to get the url or a config object containing any of the following options: 

um.update({

    url: "your-url.php",

    params: {param1: "foo", param2: "bar"}, // or a URL encoded string

    callback: yourFunction,

    scope: yourObject, //(optional scope)  

    discardUrl: false, 

    nocache: false,

    text: "Loading...",

    timeout: 30,

    scripts: false

});
The only required property is url. The optional properties nocache, text and scripts are shorthand for disableCaching, indicatorText and loadScripts and are used to set their associated property on this UpdateManager instance.

params.name: params
params.desc: (optional) The parameters to pass as either a url encoded string "param1=1&param2=2" or an object {param1: 1, param2: 2}

params.name: callback
params.desc: (optional) Callback when transaction is complete - called with signature (oElement, bSuccess, oResponse)

params.name: discardUrl
params.desc: (optional) By default when you execute an update the defaultUrl is changed to the last used url. If true, it will not store the url.

methods.name: showLoading
methods.desc: Called to update the element to "Loading" state. Override to perform custom action.

methods.name: setDefaultUrl
methods.desc: Set the defaultUrl used for updates

params.name: defaultUrl
params.desc: The url or a function to call to get the url

methods.name: updateElement
methods.desc:
Static convenience method. This method is deprecated in favor of el.load({url:'foo.php', ...}). Usage: 
Roo.UpdateManager.updateElement("my-div", "stuff.php");

params.name: el
params.desc: The element to update

params.name: url
params.desc: The url

params.name: params
params.desc: (optional) Url encoded param string or an object of name/value pairs

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional) A config object with any of the UpdateManager properties you want to set - for example: {disableCaching:true, indicatorText: "Loading data..."}

methods.name: refresh
methods.desc: Refresh the element with the last used url or defaultUrl. If there is no url, it returns immediately

params.name: callback
params.desc: (optional) Callback when transaction is complete - called with signature (oElement, bSuccess)

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Get the Element this UpdateManager is bound to

methods.name: isUpdating
methods.desc: Returns true if an update is in progress

methods.name: stopAutoRefresh
methods.desc: Stop auto refresh on this element.

methods.name: startAutoRefresh
methods.desc: Set this element to auto refresh.

params.name: interval
params.desc: How often to update (in seconds).

params.name: url
params.desc: (optional) The url for this request or a function to call to get the url (Defaults to the last used url)

params.name: params
params.desc: (optional) The parameters to pass as either a url encoded string "&param1=1&param2=2" or as an object {param1: 1, param2: 2}

params.name: callback
params.desc: (optional) Callback when transaction is complete - called with signature (oElement, bSuccess)

params.name: refreshNow
params.desc: (optional) Whether to execute the refresh now, or wait the interval

methods.name: abort
methods.desc: Aborts the executing transaction

methods.name: setRenderer
methods.desc: Set the content renderer for this UpdateManager. See {@link Roo.UpdateManager.BasicRenderer#render} for more details.

params.name: renderer
params.desc: The object implementing the render() method

methods.name: formUpdate
methods.desc:
Performs an async form post, updating this element with the response. If the form has the attribute enctype="multipart/form-data", it assumes it's a file upload.
Uses this.sslBlankUrl for SSL file uploads to prevent IE security warning.

params.name: form
params.desc: The form Id or form element

params.name: url
params.desc: (optional) The url to pass the form to. If omitted the action attribute on the form will be used.

params.name: reset
params.desc: (optional) Whether to try to reset the form after the update

params.name: callback
params.desc: (optional) Callback when transaction is complete - called with signature (oElement, bSuccess, oResponse)
